wikipedia_page.main: Richard Lane (2 January 1794 at Langham, Essex – 26 January 1870 at Hove, Sussex) was an English amateur cricketer who played first-class cricket from 1820 to 1824.  He was mainly associated with Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC), of which he was a member.  He made 4 known appearances in first-class matches.

response: *Richard Lane (MP) (died 1438), MP for Staffordshire (UK Parliament constituency)
*Richard Lane (barrister) (1584–1650), barrister and Lord Keeper of the Great Seal of England
*Richard Lane (composer) (1933–2004), American music composer and arranger
*Richard Lane (writer) (1918–2008), Australian radio and television writer
*Sir Richard Lane, 1st Baronet (died 1668), of the Lane baronets
*Richard Lane-Poole (1883–1971), senior officer in the UK Royal Navy
